Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Typhoon Storage Depot
description: The Typhoon Storage Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Typhoon Torpedoes. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Heavy Rocket Depot
description: The Heavy Rocket Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Heavy Rockets. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Bullet Box Depot
description: The Bullet Box Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Gatling Gun Ammo. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Ammo Basics
description: Keep this installed on your flagship if you want to research ammunition technologies as you fly through the galaxy.

name: Ammo Expertise License
description: You must still carry a copy of Ammo Basics if you want to research new ammunition technologies.

name: Meteor Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: Meteor Tech License
description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Meteor Missiles. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Meteor Missiles even if it is normally not stocked there.

description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Gatling Gun Ammo. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Gatling Gun Ammo even if it is normally not stocked there.

description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Inferno Rockets. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Inferno Rockets even if it is normally not stocked there.

name: Stinger Missile Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: Stinger Missile Tech License
description: Every outfitter that sells Stinger Missiles has their own recipe for the toxic sludge used. Beyond the chemical component, there is a biological aspect that induces nightmare fuel if you look too closely at what goes in...

name: Lovelace Labs License
description: The technology used in Lovelace Labs products are a corporate secret not meant to be shared outside of the company.

name: Swingfire Missile Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: Swingfire Missile Tech License
description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Swingfire Missiles. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Swingfire Missiles even if it is normally not stocked there.

name: Hicemus Logic License
description: The alien intellect behind Incipias science and technology is difficult to articulate in your own language. You'll have to reverse engineer their tech using your own foundational knowledge as a guide.

name: Star Tail Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: Star Tail Tech License
description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Star Tail Cells. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Star Tail Cells even if it is normally not stocked there.

name: Builder Anti-Missile
description: The Builders anti-missile technology isn't much more advanced than what is available from Lovelace Labs. In some ways they're inferior. Their range is severely limited and they have a slow recharge time. Also, these turrets require a crew member to operate them.

name: Builder Negator
description: Attempts to train the Ka'het to use this weapon ended with disastrous results. They possessed no sense of restraint, constantly firing the Negator until their own energy storage systems ran dry.

name: Builder Grand Cooling
description: This powerful cooling system keeps large Builder ships from overheating.

name: Builder Grand Defense
description: Builder ships had weak shields, which necessitated development of strong hulls and hull repair technologies. Devices like the Grand Defense are a rarity, as the Builders only intended them to supplement the integrated hull repair on their largest ships.

name: Builder Grand Generator
description: The most powerful generator created by the Builders, the Grand Generator is reserved for installation on the largest of Builder ships.

name: Builder Grand Accumulator
description: A bank of power accumulators condensed to store vast amounts of energy for use on larger Builder ships.

name: Builder Hull Plating (100%)
description: Builder capital ships have extremely durable hulls. This enhanced hull plating allows a ship it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant even if it wasn't specifically designed to do so. Relying on this too often will cause it to deteriorate.

name: Builder Hull Plating (90%)
description: Builder capital ships have extremely durable hulls. This enhanced hull plating allows a ship it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant even if it wasn't specifically designed to do so. Relying on this too often will cause it to deteriorate.

description: Builder capital ships have extremely durable hulls. This enhanced hull plating allows a ship it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant even if it wasn't specifically designed to do so. Relying on this too often will cause it to deteriorate.

name: Builder Hull Plating (10%)
description: Builder capital ships have extremely durable hulls. This enhanced hull plating allows a ship it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant even if it wasn't specifically designed to do so. Relying on this is risky and will probably destroy it.

name: Ka'het Durable Armor (40%)
description: The largest Ka'het have extremely tough hulls. This durable hull plating allows the Ka'het it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant. Relying on this too often may cause it to deteriorate.

name: Ka'het Durable Armor (30%)
description: The largest Ka'het have extremely tough hulls. This durable hull plating allows the Ka'het it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant. Relying on this too often may cause it to deteriorate.

name: Ka'het Durable Armor (20%)
description: The largest Ka'het have extremely tough hulls. This durable hull plating allows the Ka'het it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant. Relying on this too often may cause it to deteriorate.

name: Ka'het Durable Armor (10%)
description: The largest Ka'het have extremely tough hulls. This durable hull plating allows the Ka'het it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant. Relying on this is risky and will probably destroy it.

name: Ka'het Cloak Armor (20%)
description: This special hull plating can enhance the cloaking abilty of Ka'het that have the ability to do so. It could also allow the Ka'het it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant. However, doing so will cause it to deteriorate.

name: Ka'het Cloak Armor (10%)
description: This special hull plating can enhance the cloaking abilty of Ka'het that have the ability to do so. It can also allow the Ka'het it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant. However, doing so will definitely destroy it.

name: Ka'het Tactical Armor (30%)
description: Ka'het Tactical Armor is designed to facilitate evading enemy weapons fire. This can also allow the Ka'het it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant. Relying on this too often will cause it to deteriorate.

name: Ka'het Tactical Armor (20%)
description: Ka'het Tactical Armor is designed to facilitate evading enemy weapons fire. This can also allow the Ka'het it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant. Relying on this too often will cause it to deteriorate.

name: Ka'het Tactical Armor (10%)
description: Ka'het Tactical Armor is designed to facilitate evading enemy weapons fire. This can also allow the Ka'het it is installed on to survive diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant. Relying on this is risky and will probably destroy it.

name: Builder IFF (Damaged)
description: Normally, this would give you access to restricted areas of the Builder space stations, but this particular unit is damaged.

name: Builder IFF Transmitter
description: This device is able to transmit codes which give you access to certain restricted areas of the Builder space stations.

name: Ka'het Scanner
description: The Ka'het scanner is incredibly sensitive, but the materials used in its construction can act as a lightning rod, making your ship more vulnerable to the effects of ionization.

name: Graveyard Map
description: A map of the graveyard found aboard the Omnipotence. Several systems are marked.

name: Navarch License
description: Far'en lai ko forei lak'far.

name: Piercer Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: Piercer Tech License
description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Piercer Missiles. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Piercer Missiles even if it is normally not stocked there.

description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: Magnetic Mine Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: Magnetic Mine Tech License
description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Magnetic Mines. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Magnetic Mines even if it is normally not stocked there.

name: Blaze-Pike
description: Exile weapon design research stumbled upon an enexpected discovery when firing multiple Fire-Lances in close proximity. With just the right arrangement, it is possible to merge their beams into a single longer stream of fire that burns hotter than they would individually.

name: Inferno-Trident
description: Adding another Fire-Lance to the Blaze-Pike was a natural next step in Exile weapon design research. Mounting three them together in this array allows them to operate synergistically, creating an even longer, more powerful beam than the Blaze-Pike.

name: Scavenger Turret
description: Some Korath Exiles still use these antiquated devices in their efforts to scavenge for raw materials. An early implementation of Korath grav-ray technology, the power of the beam generated by this turret is not strong enough to move anything larger than cargo crates or other flotsam.

name: Shock-Strike Turret
description: This weapon adds an ionic charge to Grab-Strike projectiles, further incapacitating the targeted ship.

name: Thermal Obliterator
description: This weapon launches huge globs of super heated plasma that can obliterate smaller ships with a single strike. As with other thermal weapons developed by the Korath, this attack requires a lengthy cooldown period before the weapon can fire again.

name: Thermal Scorcher
description: The Thermal Scorcher is an antiquated weapon that predates the Korath civil war. It fires a large glob of super heated plasma at the target. This brutal attack generates an incredible amount of heat, requiring a significant cooldown period before the weapon can fire again.

name: Thermal Scorcher Turret
description: Only a single Thermal Scorcher is mounted on this turret. They are a rare sight now, but during the Korath civil war battleships bristling with these sorts of armaments were  common.

name: Magnetic Mine
description: Development of this weapon was rushed to deployment at the request of Navarchs who have explored the Ember Wastes.

name: Magnetic Mine Rack
description: These storage racks also act as a faraday cage to prevent the stored mines from accidentally interfering with the generators of the ship while carrying them.

name: Magnetic Mine Depot
description: The Magnetic Mine Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Magnetic Mines. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Magnetic Mine Deployer
description: This new mine does less damage overall than the old Cluster Mines, but also emits electromagnetic pulses which interferes with the generators of enemy ships caught within its blast radius.

name: Piercer Missile Depot
description: The Piercer Missile Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Piercer Missiles. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Cluster Mine Depot
description: The Cluster Mine Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Cluster Mines. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Firelight Storage Depot
description: The Firelight Storage Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Firelight Missiles. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Firestorm Torpedo Depot
description: The Firestorm Torpedo Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Firestorm Torpedoes. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Microbot Corroder
description: If you find this installed on your ship, get rid of it as soon as possible!

name: Botanical Garden
description: In addition to outfit space, this production outfit requires cargo space reserved for the commodities produced.

name: Korath Heat Shunt (Huge)
description: Korath weapons generate extreme amounts of heat, and the cooling systems they require can be massive.

name: Korath Scanner
description: While not particularly powerful or sophisticated, the Korath's unorthodox approach to scanning has the unintended side effect of jamming radar based missile guidance systems.

name: Microbot Fabricator
description: In addition to outfit space, this production outfit requires cargo space reserved for the commodities produced.

name: Security Circuit
description: Installing this onto your own ship may help prevent its computer systems from being hacked.

name: Security Circuit (Damaged)
description: This Security Circuit burned out while thwarting an aggressive hacking attempt. It can no longer protect your ship from being hacked.

name: Security Node
description: Installing this onto your own ship may help prevent its computer systems from being hacked.

name: Security Node (Damaged)
description: This Security Node burned out while thwarting an aggressive hacking attempt. It can no longer protect your ship from being hacked.

name: Shield Diluter
description: If you find this installed on your ship, get rid of it as soon as possible!

name: Systems Core (Damaged)
description: While unable to repair damage to complex systems such as itself, the machines controlled by this systems core can patch holes in the hull.

name: Systems Core (Huge)
description: This huge bank of computers, shield generators, and repair stations are designed to be used on massive World Ships and Space Stations.

name: Generator (Tinder Class)
description: Their preference for these supplemental generators instead of a standalone battery is a testament to the Korath's energy management philosophy.

name: Korath Generator (Small)
description: This miniature nuclear reactor was used by the Korath to power their fighters.

name: Korath Reactor (Large)
description: This massive reactor was designed by the Korath to meet the power needs of their largest ships.

name: Korath Thruster (Large)
description: This engine was used in the Korath capital ships.

name: Korath Steering (Large)
description: This engine was used in the Korath capital ships.

name: Fentra Predator
description: Fentra Predators are not trained to follow commands and offer no assistance in defending the ship. However releasing one onto an enemy vessel can be incredibly disruptive for defenders unprepared to deal with something so savage.

name: Meltdown Cannon
description: A weapon stolen from Farpoint's evidence vault, this bears a resemblance to the Korath Thermal Repeater Rifle. It launches a glob of burning plasma that can melt though titanium on contact. It's possible that this is the last one of these weapons to exist. The heat it generates is so intense that it can melt its own components if not given adequate time to cool down.

name: Seleptra Bloom
description: Spores infesting flesh processed into Nutrigel by a microbot fabricator do not survive the process, leaving a product that is safe to consume. Nutrigel made from meat infused with Seleptra Bloom spores are also more flavorful to Korath tastebuds.

name: Pug Ion Zapper
description: This Pug Zapper has been modified to add Ionic damage to the beam it generates.

name: Pug Ion Zapper Turret
description: The Pug Ion Zapper Turret delivers twice the ionic damage of the non-turreted version.

name: Pug Dual Seeker
description: The Pug Dual Seeker mounts two Pug Seekers onto a single gun port, providing increased firepower.

name: Pug Thunder Seeker
description: The Pug Thunder Seeker fires homing energy projectiles much like the regular seeker. The difference is that these are more resilient against anti-missiles and explode more violently on impact.

name: Tier 2 Anti-Missile
description: The Pug's Tier 2 anti-missile system features both more power and a longer range with no increases in energy consumption or heat generated.

name: Jump Drive (Limit Fuel)
description: Damage to this Jump Drive has doubled the amount of fuel it consumes with each jump.

name: Pug Prognosticator
description: This seemingly innocuous obelisk is no mere decoration. It functions as a scanner that is able to read strategic tactical data over great distances.

name: Pug Shield Supplementer
description: The Pug use this basic supplementary system to boost the already formidable shield generation on their ships.

name: Pug Shield Reinforcer
description: The Pug use this enhanced supplementary system to boost the already formidable shield generation on their ships and reinforce them against anti-shield attacks.

name: Pug Akcorlo Engines
description: These engines are intended to be the primary means of locomotion for Pug fighters and drones.

name: Pug Maretar Thruster
description: This is a huge thruster designed by the Pug. It is not quite as powerful as a similarly sized atomic engine, but it makes up for that by being almost as energy efficient as ion engines.

name: Pug Maretar Steering
description: This is a huge steering system designed by the Pug. It is not quite as powerful as a similarly sized atomic engine, but it makes up for that by being almost as energy efficient as ion engines.

name: Pug Afterburner
description: Some Pug use this afterburner to supplement their normal thrusters. Unlike regular afterburners, it consumes more energy than fuel.

name: Dream Crystal
description: Pirates have found a variety of uses for these Crystals. Some use them to control slaves while others sell them as mind altering stimulators.

name: Pug Supplemental Shielding
description: The Pug use this basic supplementary system to boost the already formidable shield generation on their ships.

name: Yottrite
`: You are forced to return to the <ship> and release the docking clamps. You rapidly distance yourself to a safe distance from the station as it implodes in on itself...`
label: retreat
description: action

name: Elysian Trident
description: An even more destructive version of the Elysian Ranseur. While planetary defense commanders feel confident that such a display of awesome power would deter any from daring to attack the Quarg again, most tacticians do not consider the extra range and power this weapon provides to be worth the additional time spent recharging its energy coils.

name: Skyharpoon
description: These immensely powerful particle beam cannons are among the simplest weapons wielded by Quarg.

name: Void Scraper
description: This powerful ramscoop can accumulate fuel reserves even in deep space. The Quarg rarely utilize this device unless embarking on excursions far beyond the jump range of their ring worlds.

name: Jump Drive (Limit Distance)
description: Damage to this Jump Drive has limited its ability to travel without the aid of a hyperspace lane. Fortunately, its consumption of fuel has also been reduced by half.

name: Threat Analyzer
description: The Quarg consider their authority over the galaxy second only to the Drak. This device can be used to quickly assess suspicious ships for potential threats to the galactic order.

name: Targe Shield Generator
description: Even the smallest example of Quarg shield generation displays defensive powers greater than what humans would normally consider to be sufficient.

name: Accelerator Core
description: This antimatter device releases extreme amounts of energy in a simple, elegant package, all while producing surprisingly little waste heat.

name: Nanocell Battery
description: Somehow, the battery chills itself as energy is drained from it, seemingly in defiance of the human understanding of thermodynamics.

name: Tiny Graviton Thruster
description: These engines also have strange capabilities which seem to violate the laws of physics as humanity understands them. Ships equipped with them accelerate faster under their own power than one would expect, while also taking less impact from external forces.

name: Tiny Graviton Steering
description: They also have strange capabilities which seem to violate the laws of physics as humanity understands them. Ships with these engines accelerate faster under their own power than one would expect, while also taking less impact from external forces.

name: Evidence of ********
description: You're not sure how this got onto your ship, but it's probably in your best interest to get rid of it before you are accused of a horrible crime against all that is decent and good in the galaxy.

name: Ancient Earth Pictograph
description: This photo is somewhat blurry, but still might be worth something to the right person...

name: Antimatter Core (Damaged)
description: Although this device is no longer functioning, it might still be worth something to the right people.

name: Celestial Compass
description: With the right mapping data, this alien device can project the movement of celestial objects across the galaxy.

name: Midnight's Lost Orphan
description: However, the entity feeds on negative emotions and will manipulate the mental state of anyone nearby towards taking actions that cause strife, pain, and suffering among friend and foe alike. Crew productivity and teamwork takes a severe downturn whenever the entity is allowed to exert itself. A simple task that would normally take one crew member to perform can require two or three as tense arguments and disagreements hamper efficiency.

name: Nanotech Battery (Damaged)
description: Although this device is no longer functioning, it might still be worth something to the right people.

name: Obsolete Star Map
description: This star map is obsolete. Someone with the right knowledge may be able to use this data to extrapolate the current positions of these star systems.

name: Quantum Shield Generator (Damaged)
description: Although this device is no longer functioning, it might still be worth something to the right people.

name: Insurgent Subjugation Gear
description: The Coalition are the youngest in the galaxy to have witnessed the mass deployment of these weapons. Their Enforcement Confrontation Gear is merely a weak replica when compared to the original.

name: Quarg Graviton Generator
description: Due to the potential collateral damage this weapon can cause, using it to defend your own ship from boarders is ill advised.

name: Quarg Quantum Phase Pistol
description: While the rogue Quarg who previously owned this could have wielded it in one hand, humans and other smaller species need both arms to use this Quantum Phase Pistol. Once locked onto the chosen target, it creates and fires a projectile which phases through any matter that would impede its trajectory. The technology that enables this weapon to work is beyond your understanding.

name: Quarg Skytrident
description: These immensely powerful particle beam weapons strike with such intensity that some of their damage penetrates shield defenses.

name: Tiny Graviton Reverser
description: Because a reverse thruster must be facing forwards, it must be installed in the weapon section of your ship instead of the engine section.

name: Inhibitor Blaster
description: This modified version of the Inhibitor Cannon lacks the firing synchronization of the standard Remnant version. The result is that instead of firing a volley of inhibitor projectiles, a group of these weapons will produce a steady stream. Intimate knowledge of how the weapon works is necessary to make this sort of modification while leaving the weapon's other attributes unchanged.

name: Lightning Tendril
description: A weapon inspired by the electrifying Luminazoa. The tentacle is difficult to control. The gunner must often struggle to aim at a target.

name: Flare Belcher
description: A weapon inspired by the fire breathing Nova Fireflies. An extra tank of hyperspace fuel is included.

name: Quill Launcher
description: A weapon inspired by the prickly Star Gazers. There is a slight delay while it regenerates the quills used as ammunition.

name: EMP Torpedo Storage Depot
description: The EMP Torpedo Storage Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use EMP torpedoes. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Teciimach Canister Depot
description: The Teciimach Canister Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Teciimach Canisters. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: Engine Restraint
description: If you find this installed on your ship, get rid of it as soon as possible!

name: Heart of Nightmare
description: The still living organ of some unknown alien creature throbs and quivers aboard the Ember Nightmare. Integrated into the ship's systems, it is not clear how this is kept alive. The system data indicates that its primary purpose involves providing the ship with a crude form of stealth via radar and optical jamming. If removed through conventional means, the organ would probably die.

name: Reverberator Rifle
description: A weapon stolen from Farpoint's evidence vault, this utilizes design concepts similar to those found in the Remant Tuning Rifle. While not as refined in its ability to pinpoint organs to liquefy, it's true potential is in the echo that grows in intensity as the soundwaves reverberate down spaceship corridors, eventually becoming strong enough to knock humans off their feet. As the sounds bounce off walls, they can even hit targets hiding behind corners. Unfortunately, this weapon is useless outside of the confines of a spaceship.

name: Remnant Fabricator License
description: The underlying secrets of Remnant technology are a closely guarded secret known only to those with the responsibility to produce it. Compartmentalization is key to safeguarding critical information.

name: EMP Torpedo Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: EMP Torpedo Tech License
description: This technical manual details how to manufacture EMP Torpedos. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer EMP Torpedos even if it is normally not stocked there.

name: Teciimach Canister Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: Teciimach Canister Tech License
description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Teciimach Canisters. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Teciimach Canisters even if it is normally not stocked there.

name: Fake Sheragi Anti-Missile
description: This is a convincing recreation of the Sheragi Anti-Missile on the Emerald Sword.

name: Fake Sheragi Cannon
description: This is a convincing recreation of a Sheragi Particle Waveform Cannon.

name: Fake Sheragi Cyclotron
description: This is a convincing recreation of the Heavy Ion Cyclotron from the Black Diamond.

name: Fake Sheragi Fabricator
description: This is a convincing recreation of the Shard Fabricator on the Black Diamond.

name: Fake Sheragi Turret
description: This is a convincing recreation of the Particle Waveform Turret on the Emerald Sword.

name: Fake Sheragi Cooling
description: This is a convincing recreation of the Large Hybrid Cooling on the Emerald Sword.

name: Fake Sheragi EWS
description: This is a convincing recreation of the Electronic Warfare System on the Emerald Sword.

name: Medium Hybrid Cooling
description: This Sheragi cooling system works both actively and passively to dissipate heat while including a cryogenic fuel tank which is used as a temporary heat reservoir.

name: Fake Sheragi Battery
description: This is a convincing recreation of the Large EM Battery on the Emerald Sword.

name: Medium EM Battery
description: This superconductive coil stores power while providing a boost to the shield regeneration of the ship.

name: Fake Sheragi Drive
description: This is a convincing recreation of the Fusion Drive on the Emerald Sword.

name: Reactor Drive
description: A smaller version of the Fusion Drive, the Reactor Drive still includes a hyperdrive, a reactor core, and powerful plasma engines.

name: High-Velocity Spike Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: High-Velocity Spike Tech License
description: This technical manual details how to manufacture High-Velocity Spikes. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer High-Velocity Spikes even if it is normally not stocked there.

name: Old House Secrets
description: The data collected from scanning the mission target. The Old Houses will execute you if you are caught in posession of this.

name: New House Secrets
description: The data collected from scanning the mission target. The New Houses will execute you if you are caught in posession of this.

name: Shadow House License
description: House Sado, a relic from an antediluvian age, still operates in the shadows of a once great civilization. As their willing pawn, you can receive certain services and missions from them.

name: "Myiara" Fire Spout
description: Denounced as a "knave's weapon", this repurposed Inductive Reverser is designed to spew out superheated gouts of flaming hyperspace fuel.

name: High-Velocity Spike Depot
description: The High-Velocity Spike Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use High-Velocity Spikes. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

name: "Ej-Byiaa" Shield Pallium
description: Predecessor shield generators are designed to function independently, making them incompatible with a Cortex Interface.

name: Multimode Armor: Adaptor
description: This configuration allows modern Successor warships to implement Predecessor multimode configurations. It also adds some rudimentary hull repair, even to ships that don't already have it.

name: Multimode Armor: Cloak
description: This material results in a configuration that allows the armor to cloak if the ship's hull is undamaged.

name: Multimode Armor: Blood
description: This material results in a configuration that allows a vessel to partially shrug off effects that would push or pull it off course. This a mere side effect of its true purpose, which allows a vessel equipped with it to safely pass through unstable wormholes.

name: Multimode Armor: Graviton
description: There is some speculation that this configuration has some deeper function that has since been long forgotten...

name: Multimode Armor: Thermal
description: This material results in a configuration that insulates the armor against heat and is highly resistant to burning.

name: Multimode Armor: Pristine
description: This material results in a configuration that strengthens the armor's structure against corrosion.

name: Multimode Armor: Regen
description: This material results in a configuration that boosts hull repair, even adding it to ships that don't already have it.

name: Multimode Armor: Stealth
description: This material results in a configuration that causes the armor to interfere with certain hostile scanning and tracking methods.

name: Multimode Armor: Plate
description: This material results in a configuration of layered plates that appears to be an early attempt at multimodal hardened armor.

name: "Tundra" Espionage Scanner
description: The Predecessors strategic scanners were used to discern the unfamiliar technologies of other species. They could also track data that their Successors cannot.

name: Photon Blade
description: Given enough time, this weapon can probably cut through stone. Avoid striking shiny surfaces like the Successor's liquid metal armor. The reflection of the blade could prove fatal.

name: Thunderhead Pod
description: A primitive version of the modern Thunderhead Launcher. The Thunderhead Pod is almost entirely dependent on external ammunition storage, resulting in a slower rate of fire. Unlike the modern launchers, these pods do not fire simultaneously when multiples are installed on a ship.

name: Thunderhead Storage Depot
description: The Thunderhead Storage Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Thunderhead Missiles. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to oversee maintenance of the ammunition.

name: Anti-Ionic Plating
description: The result of Wanderer research into the nature of ionic damage, resistance, and protection.

name: Armament Pacifier
description: If you find this installed on your ship, get rid of it as soon as possible!

name: Wanderer Advanced Cooling
description: Developed by Wanderer researchers after studying the ringworld debris you provided to them, this Wanderer cooling system is far more advanced than what they developed previously.

name: Wanderer Crafter License
description: The Wanderers view their weapons of war as [shameful, a necessary evil]. They are averse to allowing the secrets of crafting them to [proliferate, propagate] across the galaxy.

name: Thunderhead Access Temporary License
description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

name: Thunderhead Tech License
description: The Wanderers view their weapons of war as [shameful, a necessary evil]. They are averse to allowing the secrets of crafting them to [proliferate, propagate] across the galaxy.
